intro: Euphrasia iranica, commonly known as the Iranian eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Iran and parts of the Middle East. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous regions. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stem. Euphrasia iranica is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
